snippet: Separatist rebels retreated Monday from positions throughout eastern Ukraine and began building barricades in Donetsk and Luhansk in anticipation of a final stand against advancing government troops.
abstract: Separatist rebels are retreating from positions throughout eastern Ukraine, apparently blowing up bridges, and are building barricades in Donetsk and Luhansk in anticipation of a final stand against advancing government troops; Ukrainian officials say they have sealed previously porous border with Russia, with surprising successes by military.

byline.contributor: Noah Sneider contributed reporting from Slovyansk, Ukraine; Alison Smale from Berlin; and Daniel Rzhenetskyy from Kiev.

lead_paragraph: Separatist rebels retreated Monday from positions throughout eastern Ukraine and began building barricades in Donetsk and Luhansk in anticipation of a final stand against advancing government troops.

headline.main: Ukraine Rebels Are Retreating for Last Stand
headline.print_headline: Ukraine Rebels Are Retreating for Last Stand
